item.title: India vs Australia LIVE Score, 4th Test Day 4: AUS down to final wicket as Jadeja dismisses Cummins - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Score, 4th Test Day 4: AUS down to final wicket, but lead nears 300

Date: Dec 29, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The fourth day of the Test match between India and Australia at the MCG witnessed intense competition as Australian bowlers faced a spirited Indian attack. Mohammed Siraj grabbed critical wickets, including key Australian batsmen.

  • Ravindra Jadeja dismissed Pat Cummins, leaving Australia 9 wickets down.
  • Mohammed Siraj took three wickets in a fiery session.
  • Jasprit Bumrah contributed with four wickets overall.
  • India was all out for 369 in their first innings.
“A charged-up Mohammed Siraj got the big wicket of Marnus Labuschagne with his very first ball of the third session.”

This match remains finely poised with Australia holding a lead as the innings draws to a close, setting the stage for a thrilling finish.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 4th Test Day 4: Jasprit Bumrah picks 4-wickets; AUS 158/8 in Melbourne - The Indian Express
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 4th Test Day 4

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Indian Express

Jasprit Bumrah's outstanding bowling performance gave India a fighting chance as they trail by 240 runs in the ongoing 4th Test against Australia at the MCG. Marnus Labuschagne's unbeaten half-century steadies Australia's innings as they strived to regain control.

  • Bumrah takes 4 wickets for 30 runs, completing 200 dismissals in Test cricket.
  • India scored 369 in their first innings against Australia’s 474.
  • Nitish Kumar scored a crucial 114 runs, contributing significantly to India's efforts.
  • After tea, Australia moved to 187 for 9, extending their overall lead.
“The emotionally charged century in the presence of his family meant even had the Aussie crowd rooting for young Nitish.”

This match showcases a thrilling back-and-forth contest, as both teams aspire for victory in this pivotal test match.

item.title: 'Kone se, kone se': How Virat Kohli's instruction helped Mohammed Siraj dismiss Steve Smith at MCG - The Times of India
item.description:
'Kone se, kone se': How Virat Kohli's instruction helped Mohammed Siraj dismiss Steve Smith at MCG

Publication Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

In a strategic moment, Virat Kohli's on-field instructions led to the dismissal of Steve Smith by Mohammed Siraj during the fourth Test at MCG. Kohli's advice was crucial in exploiting Smith's batting tendencies, proving the effectiveness of tactical communication in cricket.

  • Kohli urged Siraj to bowl from the wide edge of the crease to target Smith's weakness.
  • The dismissal occurred as Smith edged a wide delivery to wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant.
  • Siraj's double strike was critical in breaking Australia's momentum.
“Kone se, kone se. Har ball kone se. Usko pasand hai kone se,” Kohli advised, hinting at the tactical angle to employ against Smith.

This collaboration between Kohli and Siraj underscores the importance of communication and strategy in high-stakes matches, contributing significantly to India's performance.

item.title: 'Captain' Virat Kohli does the magic in Melbourne but not with the bat - Watch - The Times of India
item.description:
'Captain' Virat Kohli's Leadership Shines in Melbourne Test Beyond Batting

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

In a thrilling encounter at the Melbourne Test against Australia, Virat Kohli displayed his leadership qualities despite not performing with the bat. Dismissed for 36 runs, his enthusiasm and guidance on the field shone as he motivated his teammates.

  • Kohli was involved in a mix-up that led to the dismissal of Yashasvi Jaiswal.
  • He actively engaged with bowlers, set field placements, and encouraged teammates during the match.
  • A notable 127-run partnership formed between Nitish Kumar Reddy and Washington Sundar turned the tide for India.
  • Former coach Ravi Shastri emphasized the positive impact of this partnership on the team's morale.
  • Jasprit Bumrah's stellar bowling performance included taking four wickets and achieving his 200th Test wicket.
“Nitish Reddy is fire, not flower; he killed it today” - Washington Sundar

Despite challenges, the Indian team displayed resilience, significantly boosting their confidence and performance as they aimed for a comeback in the Test.

item.title: Rohit Sharma Loses Cool After Yashasvi Jaiswal Drops Marnus Labuschagne's Catch: Watch - News18
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Loses Cool After Yashasvi Jaiswal Drops Marnus Labuschagne's Catch: Watch

Date: December 29, 2024

Source: News18

In a recent incident during the Boxing Day Test, Indian skipper Rohit Sharma lost his cool after Yashasvi Jaiswal dropped a simple catch of Marnus Labuschagne, who was batting on 46 runs.

  • Jaiswal dropped a routine catch during the 40th over of Australia's innings.
  • Rohit Sharma's frustration was captured in a viral video shared across social media.
  • Labuschagne capitalized on the mistake and scored a crucial half-century.
  • The match remains evenly poised with significant contributions from bowlers Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj.
“Reaction of Rohit Sharma after Yashasvi Jaiswal dropped a catch. In his 8 years of captaincy, I have never seen Virat Kohli react like this.” — Harshit (@spiral_craver)

This incident highlights the pressures faced by players during critical matches and the intensity of competitive cricket.

item.title: Norwegian chess grandmaster Magnus Carlsen quits tournament in dispute over jeans - The Hindu
item.description:
Magnus Carlsen Quits Tournament Over Dress Code Dispute

Date: December 29, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Top-ranked chess player Magnus Carlsen left the World Rapid and Blitz Chess Championships after refusing to change out of jeans, which violated the dress code.

  • Carlsen was fined $200 for wearing jeans at the tournament.
  • The Chief Arbiter requested that he change, but Carlsen declined.
  • Another participant, Ian Nepomniachtchi, was also fined but complied with the dress code.
  • Carlsen stated it became a matter of principle for him.
“I said, I'll change tomorrow if that's OK. But they said, Well, you have to change now.' At that point, it became a bit of a matter of principle for me.” - Magnus Carlsen

Carlsen's exit highlights ongoing discussions about professionalism in competitive chess and the strict adherence to regulations.

item.title: 200 wickets at sub-20 average! Jasprit Bumrah rewrites Test cricket history - The Times of India
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Breaks Record with 200 Wickets at Sub-20 Average

Publication Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

Indian fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah has made history by becoming the bowler with the best average among those with 200 or more Test wickets, achieving this milestone at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

  • Bumrah's bowling average stands at 19.56, the best among bowlers with 200+ wickets.
  • He became the fastest Indian pacer to reach 200 wickets, needing just 8,484 deliveries.
  • Bumrah surpassed legendary West Indian bowlers with his remarkable average.
  • In his 44th Test match, he equaled Ravindra Jadeja's achievement of reaching 200 wickets and is second only to Ravichandran Ashwin.
  • He currently holds the record for the most successful Indian pacer in a Test series on Australian soil.
Bumrah's precision and unmatched consistency reaffirm his status as one of the finest fast bowlers in cricket history.

This remarkable achievement by Jasprit Bumrah not only cements his legacy but also sets a benchmark for future generations of bowlers.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah Creates History, Becomes 1st Bowler In The World To... - News18
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Creates History, Becomes 1st Bowler In The World To...

Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: News18

Indian cricketer Jasprit Bumrah made history by becoming the first bowler to take more than 200 wickets in Test cricket with a bowling average of less than 20.

  • Bumrah achieved 202 wickets in just 44 Test matches.
  • He holds the record for the best bowling average in Tests for bowlers with over 200 wickets.
  • His average stands at 19.38, the best among bowlers with 200 or more wickets.
  • Bumrah surpassed Kapil Dev’s record as the fastest Indian pacer to reach 200 Test wickets.
“National asset” Jasprit Bumrah created history on Sunday, December 29...

This milestone showcases Bumrah's exceptional talent and positions him as a leading bowler in the history of cricket.

item.title: Haryana Steelers book date with three-time champions Patna Pirates in epic season finale - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Haryana Steelers showed nerves of steel to secure a berth in the final of the PKL season 11 after a thrilling win over UP Yoddhas in the first semi-final

Date: Dec 29, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Haryana Steelers secured their place in the final of the Pro Kabaddi League (PKL) season 11 with a 28-25 victory over UP Yoddhas in a thrilling semi-final match.

  • Shivam Patare, Vinay, and Rahul Sethpal were pivotal in the semi-final victory.
  • The Steelers maintained composure despite losing points during tackles.
  • Coach Manpreet Singh highlighted the team's strategy on defense against UP Yoddhas.
  • Haryana achieved their 29th All Out of the season, gaining a crucial lead.
  • Iranian allrounder Shadloui emerged as a top defender with 77 tackle points.
  • Captain Jaideep praised Rahul’s performance as a solid defender.
  • The Super Tackle in the final minutes was crucial and described as the 'turning point' by coach Manpreet.
  • Haryana now prepares to face the three-time champions, Patna Pirates, in the final.
“We will look to perform even better in the Final. We have reached this stage two times in a row now... I am sure we will fight even harder in the final and we will aim to give our 100 percent...” - Coach Manpreet Singh

The upcoming match against Patna Pirates is highly anticipated due to their previous successes in the league and the rivalry between the two teams.

item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test Day 4 Live Updates: Jasprit Bumrah Tears Into Australia, Reaches Huge Milestone - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test Day 4 Live Updates: Jasprit Bumrah Tears Into Australia, Reaches Huge Milestone

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: NDTV

This article provides live updates from the ongoing 4th Test match between India and Australia, highlighting Jasprit Bumrah's exceptional performance and significant milestone achievements on day 4 of the match.

  • Jasprit Bumrah achieves a milestone by taking multiple wickets against Australia.
  • The match continues to unfold with key moments influencing the outcome.
  • Fan reactions and expert analyses are shared throughout the day.
  • Current score updates are featured prominently.
"Bumrah's precision and skill have turned the tide for India." - Cricket Expert

This match showcases Bumrah's talent and India's cricketing prowess in this high-stakes series.

item.title: FIDE World Rapid Championships 2024: Koneru Humpy wins second title; Arjun Erigaisi finishes 5th - ESPN India
item.description:
Koneru Humpy Secures Second Title at FIDE World Rapid Championships 2024

Date: Dec 29, 2024

Source: ESPN

Koneru Humpy has claimed her second title at the FIDE World Rapid Championship in New York, solidifying her position as one of the leading figures in Indian chess.

  • Humpy finished with a score of 8.5/11 after defeating Irene Sukandar in the final round.
  • This victory marks Humpy's second world rapid title and her fourth top-three finish in the event.
  • India’s Arjun Erigaisi finished fifth, narrowly missing qualification for the Candidates tournament.
  • Amidst Humpy’s win, 18-year-old Volodar Murzin triumphed in the open section, becoming the second youngest to do so.

“Congratulations to Humpy Koneru, the 2024 FIDE Women's World Rapid Champion!” - International Chess Federation on Twitter

This championship reinforces India's status in the chess world, following a stellar year for its players.

item.title: Injury blow for Australia ahead of fifth Test against India in Sydney - ICC Cricket
item.description:
Injury Blow for Australia Ahead of Fifth Test Against India

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Australia faces a setback with the injury of Josh Inglis ahead of the fifth Test against India. Despite this, he is expected to recover for the upcoming tour of Sri Lanka.

  • Josh Inglis suffered a low-grade calf strain while fielding during the fourth Test.
  • Cricket Australia announced Inglis will leave the squad for rehabilitation.
  • A replacement for the fifth Test will be announced soon.
  • Inglis is expected to be fit for Australia’s tour of Sri Lanka following the home series.
"Josh Inglis sustained a low-grade calf strain while fielding on day two of the fourth Test match against India and will leave the squad to undergo rehabilitation." - Cricket Australia

This injury presents a challenge for Australia, but the team remains optimistic about Inglis's recovery in time for the Sri Lanka tour.

item.title: Nitish Kumar Reddy given free food, clothes, accommodation; dad requested ex-BCCI selector: 'He came to me and said...' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Nitish Kumar Reddy Achieves Historic Century in Boxing Day Test

Publication Date: December 28, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Nitish Kumar Reddy made headlines by scoring his first Test century against Australia, leading his team from a precarious position to a celebrated win.

  • Reddy scored a pivotal century against a challenging bowling attack including Pat Cummins and Mitchell Starc.
  • MSK Prasad, former chief selector, expressed deep emotional pride regarding Reddy's performance.
  • Reddy’s father felt overwhelmed, witnessing his son's remarkable achievement from the stands.
  • Reddy has consistently performed well in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, showcasing his potential as a rising star.
  • MSK Prasad highlighted how Reddy was groomed through systematic training from a young age.
“I think he stepped up to the occasion... He has raised his level and made a mark.” - MSK Prasad

This monumental achievement not only reflects Reddy's hard work and perseverance but also sets the stage for a promising future in international cricket.

item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test Day 4 Live Updates: Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammed Siraj Eye More Wickets; Australia Lead By 158 Runs At Lunch - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test Day 4 Live Updates: Mohammed Siraj Tears Into Australia, Bags Another Big Fish

Publication Date: Not Specified
Source: NDTV

This article provides live score updates from the fourth day of the Test match between India and Australia, highlighting the performance of Mohammed Siraj who took multiple wickets, significantly impacting the game.

  • Mohammed Siraj claims crucial wickets, turning the match in India's favor.
  • Live updates on the score and key moments from the match.
  • Analysis of team performances and player statistics.
“Siraj has been sensational today, taking important wickets that could change the course of the match.”

This match highlights the intense competition between India and Australia, showcasing players' skills and the excitement of Test cricket.

item.title: 'Virat Kohli back as captain' as animated gestures on Day 4 in presence of Rohit Sharma leaves commentators guessing - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Virat Kohli's Day 4 act left fans wondering if he had taken over the Test captaincy role again.

Publication Date: Dec 29, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Virat Kohli's animated gestures during the fourth Test match against Australia have sparked speculation about his potential return to the captaincy, especially as Rohit Sharma faces criticism for his leadership.

  • Kohli actively engaged with Rohit Sharma, discussing strategies and field placements.
  • Commentators noted Kohli's energetic presence, likening it to a leadership role.
  • Kohli remains India's most successful Test captain with 40 wins in 68 Tests.
  • Australia built a 105-run lead after bowling out India for 369 on Day 4.
“Virat Kohli is extremely animated on the field, as if he is captaining the side.” - Mark Nicholas

The developments during the match have reignited discussions about Kohli's captaincy potential, especially in light of current performance questions surrounding the team.

item.title: 'Miyan bhai, ghumega nahi': Nitish Reddy gives Mohammed Siraj crucial batting tips to handle Australian a - The Times of India
item.description:
Nitish Reddy Provides Key Batting Tips to Mohammed Siraj During Test Match

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Times of India

Nitish Reddy's resilience in scoring 105 not out helped India recover during the Test match, where he also guided Mohammed Siraj on handling the Australian bowling attack.

  • Nitish Reddy scored a crucial 105 not out to rescue India.
  • Reddy provided batting tips to Siraj from the non-striker's end.
  • Former coach Ravi Shastri suggested Reddy should bat higher in the order to improve team balance.
  • India's batting line-up has been struggling, adding pressure to the performance.
“Miyan bhai, off pe khade rehna. Bahar ka ball chhod do. Ghumega nahi. Ghum gya to fir kuch nahi kar sakte. Chhod do usse.”

The performance and guidance shown by Reddy highlight the importance of resilience and teamwork in cricket, particularly under pressure.

item.title: Koneru Humpy is World rapid champion - The Hindu
item.description:
Koneru Humpy is World Rapid Chess Champion

Date: December 29, 2024

Source: The Hindu

Koneru Humpy regained the women’s World rapid chess championship after five years on December 29, 2024. She finished with 8.5 points after beating Indonesia’s Irene Sukandar in the final round.

  • Koneru Humpy finished with 8.5 points.
  • She surpassed other joint leaders including D. Harika, who finished fifth.
  • Divya Deshmukh came in 21st with seven points.
  • In the open event, Russia's Volodar Murzin was the champion with 10 points.
  • Arjun Erigaisi, the best Indian performer in open, finished fifth with nine points.
“Koneru Humpy regained the women’s World rapid chess championship after a gap of five years.”

This victory marks a significant achievement in Humpy's chess career, showcasing her resilience and skill in the competitive realm of chess.

item.title: FIDE 2024: Koneru Humpy grabs second Women’s World Rapid Chess Championship title in New York - The Hindu
item.description:
Koneru Humpy wins second Women's World Rapid Chess Championship in New York

Published: December 29, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

India’s Koneru Humpy bagged an epochal second World Rapid Chess Championship title, beating Irene Sukandar of Indonesia in New York on Sunday (December 29, 2024).

  • Humpy previously won the championship in 2019 at Georgia.
  • She is only the second player to win the title more than once after China’s Ju Wenjun.
  • Humpy finished the tournament with 8.5 out of 11 points.
  • The men’s title was won by 18-year-old Volodar Murzin from Russia.
  • This achievement follows a successful year for Indian chess.
“Humpy has always excelled in the Rapid worlds as she had won a bronze medal in the 2012 edition of the event held in Moscow.”

Humpy's victory marks another milestone in her illustrious career and reflects the strength of Indian chess on the global stage.

item.title: Knocks him over! Bumrah ensures Konstas no-show in second innings at MCG - Watch - The Times of India
item.description:
Bumrah Dismisses Konstas in Second Innings at MCG

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

The law of averages caught up with Australia's opener Sam Konstas in the second innings of his Test career, as his stumps were rattled by Jasprit Bumrah early on Day 4 of the fourth Test in Melbourne.

  • Sam Konstas scored 8 runs in his second innings after a breezy 60 in the first innings.
  • India's first innings concluded at 369 runs, with Nitish Kumar Reddy being the last wicket to fall at 114 runs, dismissed by Nathan Lyon.
  • Australia took a 105-run lead before the second innings began.
  • Bumrah's delivery that dismissed Konstas moved sharply and hit the top of middle-stump.
  • Mohammed Siraj later took another wicket, dismissing Usman Khawaja.
Washington Sundar: 'Nitish Reddy is fire, not flower; he killed it today'

Overall, it was a strong performance by the Indian bowlers, setting the stage for an interesting continuation of the match.

item.title: Koneru Humpy becomes 2024 FIDE Women’s World Rapid Champion - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Koneru Humpy Becomes 2024 FIDE Women’s World Rapid Champion

Published: 29 December 2024, Source: New York

India’s Koneru Humpy secured her second World Rapid Chess Championship title by defeating Irene Sukandar of Indonesia. This victory solidifies her position as a leading player in women’s chess.

  • Humpy finished the tournament with a remarkable score of 8.5 out of 11 points.
  • She previously won the championship in 2019, making her only the second player to achieve this feat multiple times.
  • Despite challenges, including a first-round loss and difficulties with the time difference, Humpy expressed her surprise and happiness at winning.
  • Her victory further contributes to India's recent successes in international chess.
  • Humpy hopes her achievement will inspire more young Indians to pursue chess professionally.
“I think this will motivate a lot of youngsters to take up chess professionally,” said Humpy.

The event underscores a remarkable year for Indian chess, following D Gukesh’s recent classical championship win and historic gold medals at the Chess Olympiad.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah Copies Sam Konstas' Celebration After Taking His Wicket In 2nd Innings: Watch - News18
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Copies Sam Konstas' Celebration After Taking His Wicket In 2nd Innings: Watch

Publication Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: News18

Jasprit Bumrah took the wicket of Australian opener Sam Konstas in the second innings of the fourth Test, celebrating in a style reminiscent of Konstas'.

  • Bumrah dismissed Konstas on the third ball of the seventh over.
  • He copied Konstas' celebration after taking his wicket, which has gone viral.
  • Bumrah reached 150 wickets in the World Test Championship with this dismissal.
  • He is on track to break the record for most wickets in a single WTC edition.
“By taking Konstas’ wicket, Bumrah completed 150 wickets in the World Test Championship.”

Bumrah's performance continues to make headlines as he chases historic records in Test cricket.

item.title: Arjun Erigaisi’s Candidates 2026 hopes end with defeat in World Rapid Championship 2024 - Sportstar
item.description:
Arjun Erigaisi's 2026 Candidates Hopes End with World Rapid Championship Defeat

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: The Hindu

Indian Grandmaster Arjun Erigaisi's hopes of qualifying for the Candidates 2026 ended after Volodar Murzin from Russia won the FIDE World Rapid Championship 2024 in New York.

  • Erigaisi needed a clear first finish or to win via tiebreaks to qualify for the Candidates.
  • Fabiano Caruana qualified for Candidates 2026 after leading the FIDE Circuit 2024 leaderboard.
  • Caruana took the lead in the 2024 FIDE Circuit race after winning the Saint Louis Masters earlier in the month.
  • Erigaisi finished second in the Qatar Masters Open 2024, unable to catch up to Caruana.
"A title win at World Rapid would have given Arjun a little over 20 points."

The Candidates Tournament 2026 will determine who challenges the youngest-ever World Champion, D. Gukesh, who recently claimed the title.

The FIDE Circuit serves as a qualifying path for the Candidates Tournament, with players needing to achieve the highest results in eligible tournaments.
